results.description: Nanotechnology offers specific benefits that will enable the future of cancer care.  Find out here what these benefits are.
results.title: Benefits of Nanotechnology for Cancer - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Nanotechnology offers the means to target therapies directly and selectively to cancerous cells and neoplasms.  With these tools, clinicians can safely and effectively deliver chemotherapy, radiotherapy, and the next generation of immuno- and gene therapies to the tumor.  Futhermore, surgical resection of tumors can be guided and enhanced by way of nanotechnology tools.  Find out how nanotechnology will offer the next generation of our therapeutic arsenal to the patient.
results.title: Nanotechnology Cancer Therapy and Treatment - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Will offer nanotherapeutic formulations and novel approaches targeting multiple components of the tumor and its microenvironment, specifically for high-grade serous ovarian cancers.
results.title: The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center—Targeted Therapeutics for Ovarian Cancer - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Winning the battle in cancer is by way of its earlier detection.  Find out here how nanotechnology for cancer can enable the next generation of diagnostics.
results.title: Nanotechnology and Early Cancer Detection and Diagnosis - National Cancer Institute

results.description: This project uses the mouse eye as a non-surgical window for highly efficient, optical investigation of all aspects of syngeneic or xenograft models, using a state-of-the-art ocular imaging facility, the "EyePod."
results.title: The Rodent Eye as a Non-Invasive Window for Understanding Cancer Nanotherapeutics - National Cancer Institute

results.description: To overcome the limitations of current drugs to treat brain tumors, Case Western University seeks to integrate the unique features of a chain-like nanoparticle with the appropriate combination of complementary drugs.
results.title: Case Western Reserve University — Treatment of Glioblastoma Using Chain-Like Nanoparticles - National Cancer Institute

results.description: Improves systemic therapies of cancer using soft nanomaterials that can penetrate deep into tumors and deliver potent anticancer agents to targeted cancer cells.
results.title: Targeted Core Shell Nanogels for Triple Negative Breast Cancer - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The NCI Office of Cancer Nanotechnology Research has had a major impact on bringing novel nano-enabled solutions through the pre-clinical space.  The strategic framework of this effort is presented here.
results.title: Nanotechnology in Cancer Research - National Cancer Institute

results.description: The Carolina Center of Cancer Nanotechnology Excellence (CCNE) is an NCI-funded multidisciplinary collaboration among a range of disciplines using nano approaches for cancer disease management and treatment.
results.title: Nano Approaches to Modulate Host Cell Response - National Cancer Institute

results.description: This project develops a dual-targeted and stroma breaking theranostic nanoparticle platform to address an unmet, clinical challenge of poor drug delivery efficiency in the application of nanomedicine to cancer therapy.
results.title: Stroma Breaking Theranostic Nanoparticles for Targeted Pancreatic Cancer Therapy - National Cancer Institute
